page.title: 02STAINLAND VILLAGE
page.content: { STAINLAND} Stainland is in the South Pennines and is between the towns of Halifax and Huddersfield. Stainland got its name from stoney land because it is built on sand stone. Most of the houses are old and built of stone, some have been sandblasted to make them look new. There is a new housing estate called Fall Spring Gardens, and these houses are built of yellow brick. Other new houses are built of fake stone called Marshalite. In the middle of Stainland there is a park and playing field. Here you can play football and rugby in winter, and cricket, tennis, bowls and putting in summer. There are swings, slides and a climbing frame to play on all year round. The park was built as a War Memorial.
